p
Class ShapeObject

java.lang.Object
  p.MovingObject
      p.ShapeObject
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Comparable
public class ShapeObject
extends MovingObject

Represents a(n moving) object which has a shape (which is not used in the game, for space matters we merged with its inheriter classes!).
The class also represents the rocket, if instances are created by callin the public constructor with false parameter.
The class also represents the player, if instances are created by callin the public constructor with true parameter. The class also used to represent an explosion of a rocket or an aircraft, or rather to represent the explosion itself.

Author:
Andras Belicza

 boolean step()
          Steps the object.

Field Detail

shape

public final java.awt.Polygon shape
Polygon of the object.

targetPos

public float[] targetPos
Reference to the position of the rockets target. (Rockets are "target followers".)

shield

public float shield
State of the shield of the player. 0 means gone, 1 means undamaged.

reloadings

public float[] reloadings
Array of reloading states of the weapons. 0 means out, 1 means fully operational. Length of the array is 2.

direction

public float direction
Direction of the player. This is an angle between -PI and PI rad.

explosionRadius

public java.lang.Float explosionRadius
Radius of the explosion or null if this object does not represents an explosion.

isPlayer

public final boolean isPlayer
Tells whether the shape object is a player or a rocket.

Constructor Detail

ShapeObject

public ShapeObject(boolean isPlayer)
Creates a ShapeObject, a rocket.

Parameters:
isPlayer - tells whether the creatable shape object will be a player or a rocket
Method Detail

step

public boolean step()
Steps the object.
Stepping an shapeObject means not only adding the velocity to the position but also recalculating the points of its polygon.

Overrides:
step in class MovingObject
Returns:
true if step has been cut in order to stay inside the land, false otherwise
